docs.lead_paragraph: Senator John McCain has disputed, patiently, accusations that he has a short temper. But his sarcastic, and sometimes testy, responses to The Des Moines Register's editorial board, which the Iowa newspaper videotaped and posted online Wednesday, are not likely to help him make that case. ''Really?'' he responded to a question about possible concern from voters about Gov. Sarah Palin's level of experience. ''I haven't detected that in the polls; I haven't detected that among the base. If there's a Georgetown cocktail party person who, quote, calls himself a conservative who doesn't like her, good luck.''
docs.abstract: Republican presidential candidate John McCain's videotaped sarcastic and sometimes testy responses to The Des Moines Register's editorial board may undermine his efforts to play down accusations that he has short temper; video posted online shows McCain responding to questions about vice presidential candidate Sarah Palin's experience, health insurance and truthfulness of his campaign ads (M)
docs.snippet: Senator John McCain has disputed, patiently, accusations that he has a short temper. But his sarcastic, and sometimes testy, responses to The Des Moines Register's editorial board, which the Iowa newspaper videotaped and posted online Wednesday, are...

docs.lead_paragraph: We have been here before. We know all too well that moment when the world seems incomprehensible, and somewhat dangerous, and we don't really understand it ourselves - and then we have to turn around and explain it to our children. Even if it is not happening directly to us, it is happening around us in an all-enveloping and overwhelming way.

headline.main: Money Meltdown: What to Tell the Kids?

docs.abstract: Guiding your children through the ins and outs of the financial crisis.
docs.snippet: Guiding your children through the ins and outs of the financial crisis.

docs.lead_paragraph: Following is the first set of answers from the author of "Frommer's NYC Free & Dirt Cheap," Ethan Wolff. This week, he answered selected City Room readers' questions about where to find bargains and free events and how to live cheaply in New York. We are no longer accepting questions for this feature.

headline.main: Answers About Living Cheaply in New York

docs.lead_paragraph: By the time the doors open to the soup kitchen at St. Benedict the Moor Neighborhood Center, the line is already snaking down St. Ann's Avenue.

headline.main: For Those on the Soup Line, No Rescue Plans

docs.abstract: While politicians debate a $700 billion plan for Wall Street, those running a Bronx soup kitchen and food pantry worry that they will run out of food in a matter of days, with no bailout in sight.
docs.snippet: While politicians debate a $700 billion plan for Wall Street, those running a Bronx soup kitchen and food pantry worry that they will run out of food in a matter of days, with no bailout in sight.

docs.lead_paragraph: Concern is growing that the credit market crisis, and the role governments are playing to bail out banks, could have a devastating effect on markets for carbon and on government support for renewable energy.

headline.main: Will the Fiscal Crisis Hobble the Clean-Energy Industry?

docs.abstract: The clean-energy business, two analysts say, may suffer some setbacks in the current financial crisis, but it is here to stay...

docs.lead_paragraph: It would be a shame if a bill that calls for mental health parity in insurance coverage were allowed to die while Congress is focused on the economic crisis.
